sentences: Mönnikhuseni käsu all seisev salk oli .. nime poolest Rootsi kuninga teenistuses.
.. ja ilm peaaegu pilkaspime, sest lund oli ainult nime poolest.
context: The word 'nime' is a grammatical form in Estonian. It can be either the genitive singular or partitive singular form of the word 'nimi'. As genitive singular, it means 'of name' or 'by name'. As partitive singular, it functions as an adverbial phrase meaning 'in name only', 'formally', or 'on paper only' - indicating something exists merely in name rather than reality.
